raw_comment:
1) What do you notice?
	Many 15-24 year olds generally believe that the world is changing for the better with each generation.
2) What do you wonder?
	I wonder why older folks tend to disagree with the 15-24 year olds in their views about the future, maybe its because they were brought up a different way and they see things differently than those who were raised in more recent years.
3) How does this relate to you and your community?
	The U.S is one of the higher countries in the graph, suggesting that we are evolving overtime and creating more opportunities for ourselves.
4) What’s going on in this graph? Create a catchy headline that captures the graph’s main idea.
Life as a younger person in their teens or 20s seems to be improving over time, can the same be said for the older generation?
ace_sentences: Many people who are 15 years old to 24 years old believe that the world is changing for the better with each generation.
I wonder why many older people disagree with people who are 15 years old to 24 years old about the future.
Older people were brought up in a different way than younger people.
Older people may see things differently than people who were raised in more recent years.
The United States is one of the highest countries in the graph.
This suggests that the United States is evolving over time.
This suggests that people in the United States create more opportunities for themselves over time.
Life for a person in the teens or in the twenties seems to improve over time.
Can the same be said for an older person?
